body:
Two weeks ago we were observing Windows nodes crashing and rebooting during our e2e test runs on GCE (https://testgrid.k8s.io/sig-windows#gce-windows-master&width=20). Analyzing the crash dumps showed a fault in the NTFS driver while the MsMpEng.exe process was running. MsMpEng.exe appears to be part of the Windows Defender anti-malware component.

To address the crashes we did two things: 1) disabled Windows Defender on our Windows e2e test nodes (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/74444), and 2) included February's Windows updates on our Windows nodes. After these two things the crashes seem to have stopped.

Two days ago we re-enabled Windows Defender on our Windows nodes: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/74928. Unfortunately we started seeing the Windows node crashes again, starting with run 228 on https://testgrid.k8s.io/sig-windows#gce-windows-master&width=20. (To determine if a node crash occurred we open the results link for the test run, open the artifacts for each Windows node and look for a MEMORY.dmp file (e.g. https://gcsweb.k8s.io/gcs/kubernetes-jenkins/logs/ci-kubernetes-e2e-windows-gce/228/artifacts/e2e-228-36623-windows-node-group-q4jk/)). We analyzed one of these crash dump files and it looked the same as what we saw a couple weeks ago: fault in NTFS while MsMpEng.exe was running.

For now we've merged https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/75055 we re-disables Windows Defender on our e2e Windows nodes. Since that PR merged early this morning (starting with run 246) none of our Windows nodes have crashed, strongly implicating Windows Defender as contributing to the crashes.

Since the failure is happening in the NTFS driver we'll need help from Microsoft folks to debug it. The memory dump files are publicly available from the test artifacts (runs 228 - 245), and I've copied a WinDbg crash analysis below. Additionally, some Windows version information is available in the serial-1.log file for each Windows node, also copied below.

I don't have any great ideas about why the combination of K8s e2e tests and Windows Defender seems to cause the crash; we don't have any other reports of this failure happening in Windows VMs on GCE.

Version info:
```
Windows version:

Major  Minor  Build  Revision
-----  -----  -----  --------
10     0      17763  0       


Installed hotfixes:

Source        Description      HotFixID      InstalledBy          InstalledOn              
------        -----------      --------      -----------          -----------              
E2E-228-36... Update           KB4483452     NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM  2/26/2019 12:00:00 AM    
E2E-228-36... Security Update  KB4470788     NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM  2/26/2019 12:00:00 AM    
E2E-228-36... Security Update  KB4487044     NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM  2/26/2019 12:00:00 AM    
```

title: Windows GCE e2e test nodes crashing when Windows Defender is enabled
